components.description:
A crescent moon, as in its waxing crescent phase. Depicts the moon as a thin, golden crescent, curving to the right and not displaying the remaining outline of the moon.

May be used for the moon more generally and saying good night. May be used in association with ‚ò™Ô∏è Star and Crescent, a popular but unofficial symbol of Islam.

As of March 2019, sending this emoji over Facebook Messenger activates dark mode.

See also üåí Waxing Crescent Moon.

Google’s moon once resembled a waning crescent moon, Twitter and Facebook's moons were previously silver.
components.title: Crescent Moon

description:
A crescent moon, as in its waxing crescent phase. Depicts the moon as a thin, golden crescent, curving to the right and not displaying the remaining outline of the moon.

May be used for the moon more generally and saying good night. May be used in association with ‚ò™Ô∏è Star and Crescent, a popular but unofficial symbol of Islam.

As of March 2019, sending this emoji over Facebook Messenger activates dark mode.

title: Crescent Moon

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Moon, sun, and star symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Crescent Moon was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/crescent-moon/
emoji_net_data.name: crescent moon

bn:00072016n: The Sky is the portion of outer space or the atmosphere visible from a position within a world.
Everything that is above the surface of the Earth.
The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the ground during the day.
The sky is everything that lies above the surface of the Earth, including the atmosphere and outer space.
The atmosphere and outer space as viewed from the earth
The part of the earth's atmosphere and space outside it that is visible from earth's surface. During the day it is perceived as blue, and at night as black.

bn:00072101n: A natural and periodic state of rest during which consciousness of the world is suspended
A periodic state of physiological rest during which consciousness is suspended and metabolic rate is decreased.
The state of reduced consciousness during which a human or animal rests in a daily rhythm.
Sleep is a naturally recurring state of bodily rest involving altered consciousness, relatively inhibited sensory activity, and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles.
State characterized by reduced or absent consciousness
In animals, sleep is a naturally recurring state characterized by altered consciousness, relatively inhibited sensory activity, and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles.

bn:00023749n: Any shape resembling the curved shape of the moon in its first or last quarters
Crescent is a solitaire card game played with two decks of playing cards mixed together.

bn:00055809n: Any substantially sized natural satellite of a planet.
The sole natural satellite of the Earth.
The natural satellite of the Earth
The first planet from Earth in the Ptolemaic geocentric model
The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite.

bn:00031998n: "Abide with Me" is a Christian hymn by Scottish Anglican Henry Francis Lyte most often sung to English composer William Henry Monk's tune entitled "Eventide".
The latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall)
Period of the day between 5:00 pm and 9:00 pm
The evening before a certain day.
Evening is the period between the late afternoon and night when daylight is decreasing, around dinner time.
The time of the day between the approximate time of midwinter dusk and midnight (compare afternoon); the period after the end of regular office working hours.
That part of the day in which daylight decreases and the night falls.
Evening in its primary meaning is the period of the day between afternoon and night.

bn:00025236n: Night or nighttime is the period of time between the sunset and the sunrise when the Sun is below the horizon.
The time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
The period between sunset and sunrise, when a location faces far away from the sun, thus when the sky is dark.
Night is the period of time when the sun is below the horizon.
Part of the day when the Sun is not aloft
The hours of darkness between sunset and sunrise; the night.
